sentences.english: Balzac failures never faltered his drive to continue to write novels and novelettes .
sentences.chinese: 他屡屡失败，但从未放弃过继续写小说的念头。

sentences.english: An image of "feed cattles" appeared frequently in Lu Yous later poems.
sentences.chinese: 陆游后期诗歌作品中屡屡出现“饭牛”意象。

sentences.english: He had always managed to lead his team to victory and had never lost a game.
sentences.chinese: 他屡屡率领他的球队登上巅峰，从未输过一场比赛。

sentences.english: Emma could now imagine why her own attentions had been slighted.
sentences.chinese: 爱玛现在想象得出，为什么她的关心屡屡受到轻慢。

sentences.english: Whites and ivories made several appearances, almost in a bridal inspired way.
sentences.chinese: 白色和象牙白屡屡出现，几乎是来自新娘装的灵感。

sentences.english: He said he had tried to quit several times but always failed.
sentences.chinese: 他说他多次尽力戒烟，但屡屡告败。

sentences.english: Perhaps I really do not disappointing, it has repeatedly let her down.
sentences.chinese: 或许我真的很不争气，屡屡让她失望吧。

sentences.english: Tell-tale wisps of grey smoke rise above the tree cover to point the way.
sentences.chinese: 屡屡的灰烟飘荡在上空指向工厂的方向。

sentences.english: There has Melaleuca wave of network events to occur.
sentences.chinese: 一石激起千层波的网络事件屡屡发生。

sentences.english: Work often hear the words to thank the visitors, always feel very happy.
sentences.chinese: 工作中屡屡听到旅客地谢语，老是心里非常欢愉地。

sentences.english: If there's spirit, the scoreboard takes care of itself.
sentences.chinese: 有了团队精神，屡屡得分便不在话下了。

sentences.english: Success is going from failure to failure without losing your enthusiam.
sentences.chinese: 成功就是屡屡失败却不失热情。

definition: many times/on more than one occasion
